6d5d22bdb3cf920dd706c9a1f94f376c (04:59): could anybody give me a hint on how i can make a div that doesn't cause a page break?
6d5d22bdb3cf920dd706c9a1f94f376c (05:00): line-break i guess it would be called, sorry.
6d5d22bdb3cf920dd706c9a1f94f376c (05:08): where does this style property get placed in?
4fe5d4ae76a13afea3b0ed1a483c5c15 (05:11): frame tags are not longer recommend right?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (05:12): rnst: sure, given the proper doctype declaration
6d5d22bdb3cf920dd706c9a1f94f376c (05:12): it caused a page break after the first and before the second
6d5d22bdb3cf920dd706c9a1f94f376c (05:13): between the two div's it caused a page break
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (05:13): rnst: you have to use a frameset doctype for frame's, or a transitional doctype for iframe's

c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (05:14): rnst, doctype: Take a gander at the fine document type definitions available at http://webstandards.org/learn/reference/charts/doctype-switch/ (HTML 4.01 Strict is recommended). A more complete list: http://www.w3.org/QA/2002/04/valid-dtd-list.html

6d5d22bdb3cf920dd706c9a1f94f376c (05:16): im sure theres a simple solution to cause no page-break's with <div's
